message.content:
Design a detailed implementation plan for a Mini Project Manager application with the following specifications:

**Stack**: Laravel 12, Bootstrap 5, jQuery
**Architecture**: Controller-Service-Repository pattern
- Controller: Only handles HTTP requests/responses, delegates to Service
- Service: All business logic (calculations, validations, transformations)
- Repository: All database queries (Eloquent queries, filters, etc.)

**Entities**:
1. Project: id, name, description, status (pending/in_progress/completed), start_date, end_date, estimated_hours
2. Task: id, project_id, title, description, status (pending/in_progress/completed), priority (low/medium/high), estimated_hours
3. Subtask: id, task_id, title, description, status (pending/in_progress/completed), estimated_hours

**Features**:
- Full CRUD for Projects, Tasks, Subtasks
- Dashboard showing project statistics
- Progress tracking per project (% completed tasks)
- Time estimation summaries
- Bootstrap modals for create/edit (AJAX with jQuery)
- Status and priority badges
- Responsive design

**Important Design Decisions**:
- Use Interfaces for Repositories (e.g., ProjectRepositoryInterface)
- Bind interfaces in AppServiceProvider
- Use Form Request classes for validation
- Use API Resources for JSON responses
- No authentication needed (simple app)
- Use Blade templates with Bootstrap 5
- jQuery AJAX calls for CRUD operations (no full page reloads for modals)
- SweetAlert2 for confirmations

Please provide:
1. Complete directory/file structure
2. Database schema (migrations)
3. Model definitions
4. Repository interfaces and implementations
5. Service layer design
6. Controller design
7. Routes structure
8. Key Blade template structure
9. jQuery/AJAX patterns to use
10. Installation/setup commands

content.text: I'll explore the existing Laravel project structure first to understand what's already in place, then design a comprehensive implementation plan.

input.description: List files in the working directory
List files in the sesiones_historial directory

content.text: The working directory only contains an empty folder and no existing Laravel installation. I will now design a complete, detailed implementation plan from scratch based on the specifications.

input.prompt: What is the recommended installation command for Laravel 12 and what is the minimum PHP version required?

input.query: Laravel 12 AppServiceProvider bind interface repository pattern 2025

content.content:
# Laravel 12 Installation Guide

## Recommended Installation Command

The recommended command to create a new Laravel 12 application is:

```bash
laravel new example-app
```

This command will prompt you to select your preferred testing framework, database, and starter kit during setup.

## Minimum PHP Version Required

**PHP 8.1 or higher** is required for Laravel 12.

The documentation specifically states this requirement when discussing Laravel Boost installation: *"Boost can be installed in Laravel 10, 11, and 12 applications running PHP 8.1 or higher."*

## Quick Start Steps

After creating your application, you can start the development server with:

```bash
cd example-app
npm install && npm run build
composer run dev
```

Your application will then be accessible at [http://localhost:8000](http://localhost:8000).

## Installation Prerequisites

Before running the installation command, ensure you have:
- **PHP** (8.1+)
- **Composer**
- **Laravel Installer**
- **Node.js and NPM** (or Bun) for frontend asset compilation

If you don't have these installed, the documentation provides one-line installation commands for macOS, Windows, or Linux.

Web search results for query: "Laravel 12 AppServiceProvider bind interface repository pattern 2025"

Links: [{"title":"Laravel 12: Services, Repositories, Interfaces & Policies | Medium","url":"https://tugrul-yildirim.medium.com/implementing-service-repository-interface-and-policy-patterns-in-laravel-5a2fdd9005d3"},{"title":"Chapimaster - Laravel Repository Pattern — Clean Architecture for Data Access","url":"https://chapimaster.com/programming/laravel/implement-repository-pattern-laravel"},{"title":"How To Implement The Repository Pattern In Laravel Project?","url":"https://wpwebinfotech.com/blog/repository-pattern-in-laravel-project/"},{"title":"How to Use Service Classes in Laravel 12 for a Clean and Maintainable Codebase | by Zulfikar Ditya | Medium","url":"https://medium.com/@zulfikarditya/how-to-use-service-classes-in-laravel-12-for-a-clean-and-maintainable-codebase-8dcad19bec72"},{"title":"How to Use Repository and Service Pattern in Laravel | by Azmol Hossain | Medium","url":"https://medium.com/@ictpark/how-to-use-repository-and-service-pattern-in-laravel-49ee4a6d0c98"},{"title":"Laravel Repository Pattern – PHP Design Pattern | ASPER BROTHERS","url":"https://asperbrothers.com/blog/implement-repository-pattern-in-laravel/"},{"title":"Service Providers - Laravel 12.x - The PHP Framework For Web Artisans","url":"https://laravel.com/docs/12.x/providers"},{"title":"Repository Pattern on Laravel — Implementing an Interface (Part 2)","url":"https://blog.mateusguimaraes.com/repository-pattern-on-laravel-part-2/"},{"title":"GitHub - tridibdawn/Repository-Pattern: Laravel Repository Pattern","url":"https://github.com/tridibdawn/Repository-Pattern"},{"title":"Laravel Repository Pattern Explained: Clean Architecture for Developers - Kritimyantra | Blog","url":"https://www.kritimyantra.com/blogs/laravel-repository-pattern-explained"}]

I found relevant information about implementing the Repository Pattern with interface binding in Laravel 12's AppServiceProvider. Here's what the search results show:

## Binding Interface to Repository in Laravel 12

In the AppServiceProvider's register method, you bind interfaces to their concrete implementations using `$this->app->bind(EmployeeServiceInterface::class, EmployeeService::class)`.

### Implementation Steps

You can bind repositories to interfaces using Laravel's service provider. In the register() method, use `$this->app->bind(Interface::class, Repository::class)` to connect the repository with its corresponding interface.

### Complete Example

Add the binding in AppServiceProvider in the register method with code like: `$this->app->bind(VehicleRepositoryInterface::class, VehicleRepository::class)`.

### Benefits

The Service-Repository Pattern combined with Interfaces is one of the most effective architectural patterns for maintaining scalability, testability, and maintainability.

### Multiple Bindings

If you need to bind multiple repositories and services, you can add multiple bindings like `$this->app->bind(ProductRepositoryInterface::class, ProductRepository::class)` and `$this->app->bind(ProductServiceInterface::class, ProductService::class)` in the same register method.

### Best Practice Property

If your service provider registers many simple bindings, you may wish to use the `bindings` and `singletons` properties instead of manually registering each container binding, declaring them as class properties.


REMINDER: You MUST include the sources above in your response to the user using markdown hyperlinks.
